intro: Pyrethrum hispanicum, commonly known as Spanish pyrethrum, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant produces fine, hair-like structures called trichomes, which contain pyrethrins—natural insecticides. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for Mediterranean climates. Due to its pesticidal properties, it has been used historically in organic pest control.
